learning_outcomes.description: Identify earth materials including basic minerals, different rock types and important fossil groups.
Explain how we know the structure and character of the Earths core, mantle, and crust and their general composition.
Articulate how the phenomenon of plate tectonics leads to the evolution of the Earth's surface, climate, biosphere, hydrosphere and cryosphere

Evaluate how the fundamental earth processes and materials relate to human impacts on the environment, with an emphasis on the importance of Earth Sciences in the understanding and management of the natural environment.

Apply your knowledge of rock types, geological time, tectonic processes and fossil to create a geological history of South East Queensland. Understand how this links to the evolution of the earth through time.

assessments.task_description:
All practical exercises will be assessable. The total practical component of ERTH1000 is weighted at 20%. Completed practical documents are to be submitted for assessment via Inspera the week following the Practical, as outlined by the due dates.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission via Inspera only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission details.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Practical 1 Class exam: 13/04/2026 12:00 pm

Practical 2 Class exam: 13/04/2026 1:00 pm
assessments.task_description:
In-semester exam, covering all lecture and practical material up to the week in which the exam is held. This will be an in-person MCQ test and will be held in both practical classes on the 13th of April.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
You will submit a field report and your notes from fieldwork to two sites in Northern New South Wales. This will develop your skills in recognising rocks, understanding the processes and environments in which they form.

The field trip is a compulsory component of the course.

For students who miss the field trip, you may only be eligible for alternative arrangement if exceptional circumstances arise that prevent you from attending the fieldtrip. Please contact your course coordinator with supporting documentation of the exceptional circumstances that prevented you from attending for consideration of an alternate arrangement.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

We will work through approaches to using AI tools for your report during class time.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Final examination held during the examination period. Examination covers lectures, practicals, assigned readings, group discussion sessions and fieldtrip from the entire semester.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Earth Science Laboratory Practicals

Practicals are three hours and will take place most weeks but see timetable.

In Week 6 we will undertake a short field trip to prepare the class with the skills for the main field trip in week 7.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Earth Science Laboratory Practicals Practicals are three hours and will take place most weeks but see timetable. In Week 6 we will undertake a short field trip to prepare the class with the skills for the main field trip in week 7.

learning_activities.topic:
Field trip

The field trip is a compulsory component of the course.

Weekend field trip to two sites in Northern NSW to examine local rock formations and produce a report. Students need only attend ONE of the days on this weekend which will happen at the end of week 7 on the 18th OR the 19th of April.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
